vehicle module¶

Created on Sun Jan 27 16:42:23 2019

@author: draz

class vehicle.Vehicle(t, data, soc_target=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents all electric vehicles within the simulation.

Parameters

  • t (int) – Current time step.

  • soc_target (float) – The SOC of the electric vehicle wants to have when leaving.

Variables

  • self.arrival_time – The arrival time of the vehicle.

  • self.car_id – Identifier of the car.

  • self.parking_time – Parking time in hours.

  • self.mode – Charging: 1 and discharging 0.

  • self.battery_size – Battery capacity in kWh.

  • self.time_start_xcharging – Time the charging/discharging begins.

  • self.soc_min – SOC minimum (0 to 1). Can’t be discharged below.

  • self.power_min – Minimal power the car can charge or discharge.

  • self.power_max – Maximal power the car can charge or discharge.

  • self.eta_c – Charging efficiency (0 to 1).

  • self.eta_d – Discharging efficiency (0 to 1.

  • self.self_dis – Self-discharge of the battery in kW.

  • self.requested_xcapacity – The requested power of the car in kW.

  • self.xcharging_power – Power the vehicle is charging/discharging with per time step.

  • self.soc – SOC of the vehicle.

  • self.soc_target – SOC target to be fullfilled while parking time if possible.

check_power()¶

Check if the SOC and the charging/discharging capacity is within the limits and Xcharge the battery.

ev_data()¶

Print vehicle data.

update_xcharge(tau)¶

Update the battery SOC according to the power within the time step. Update the time period the battery can be Xcharged at the current power.

Parameters

tau (float) – Length of one time step.

xcharge_battery()¶

Adjusting the charging/discharging capacity based on the current SOC of the vehicle.
